paragraphs.name: cf31
paragraphs.text: Bruce’s letter exactly follows the form set by Napoleon Hill some decades before. I wrote a similar, but way more humble “Definite Chief Aim” for myself and achieved it. According to Hill, one should write his or her aim, read it daily, internalize it and develop a plan in accordance with it. Worked for Bruce!

2c10c9e41dd0.title: Bruce’s letter exactly follows the form set by Napoleon Hill some decades before.

paragraphs.name: fd76
paragraphs.text: UTEP is an open campus that keeps academic records forever, but it was not until I could visualize earning a degree and walking at graduation that I made a move. Not until then did I have the courage to call the university and ask to reinstate me. Once a 19 year old student dropout, they reconciled 60+ hours and made a degree plan for the over 45 me.

paragraphs.text: Nice article here, Charles. I followed Bruce Lee for a good long while in my younger years and was always blown away with how much belief he had in himself. He had no doubt, as his letter said, that he would achieve what he wanted to achieve. In re-reading this, it makes me reflect on how visualisation comes about. Often, you might try and visualise…

His way of thought, his cockiness and his compassion — his genius. He was an amazing man and I get that just from his writings and the books and people that spoke of him, his way of life.

paragraphs.name: 0c4a
paragraphs.text: When you drop a pebble into a pool of water, the pebble starts a series of ripples that expand until they encompass the whole pool. This is exactly what will happen when I give my ideas a definite plan of action. Right now, I can project my thoughts into the future, I can see ahead of me. I dream (remember that practical dreamers never quit). I may now own nothing but a little place down in basement, but once my imagination has got up to a full head of steam, I can see painted on a canvas of my mind a picture of a fine, big five or six storey Gung Fu Institute with branches all over the States. I am not easily discouraged, readily visualize myself as overcoming obstacles, winning out over setbacks, achieving “impossible” objectives.

paragraphs.name: 12c7
paragraphs.text: Before he passed away, some asked the late Dr Charles P. Steimetz, the electrical genius, in his opinion “What branch of science would make the most progress in the next twenty-five years?” He paused and thought for several minutes then like a flash replied, “spiritual realisation.” When a man comes to a conscious vital realisation of those great spiritual forces within himself and begins to use those forces in science, in business and in life, his progress in the future will be unparalleled.

paragraphs.name: 3ce1
paragraphs.text: Probably, people will say I’m too conscious of success. Well, I am not. You see, my will to do springs from the knowledge that I CAN DO. I’m only being natural, for there is no fear or doubt inside my mind.
